## Natural History {.smaller background-color="#FFFCEB"}

::: {.columns .pv4}
::: {.column width="70%"}
1.  Amphibians have been on [earth]{.b .blue} since the [Devonian]{.b .green} 
    -   This is a long time

::: {.fragment .mt1}
2.  Global decline of [amphibians]{.b .orange} has only occurred in **our** lifetimes
    -   This is not a long time
:::

::: {.fragment .mt1}
3.  [Aquatic ecosystems]{.b .blue} are at highest risk
    -   Amphibians form a link between the terrestrial and aquatic worlds
:::

::: {.fragment .mt1}
4.  [Sentinel]{.b .gold} species like Foothill yellow-legged frogs integrate energy of ecosystems
    - And can tell us much about the "health" of a system
:::
:::

## [*Rana boylii*]{.orange} Distribution {background-color="#FFFCEB"}

::: {.columns .pv4}

::: {.column width="60%"}
 - Range from Upper San Gabriel River in CA to Willamette Valley, OR

::: {.fragment .mt1}
 - Two specimens were collected in 1965 in Baja California (Loomis 1965), but never detected after (Welsh 1988, Hollingsworth 2000, Grismer 2002, Stebbins 2003).
:::
:::

## Life History I {.smaller background-color="#FFFCEB"}

::: {.columns .pv4}
::: {.column .pr4 width="50%" .incremental}
#### The Basics

1. Adults breed in the spring (*amplexus*)
2. Females pick oviposition location
3. External fertilization, egg masses ~2-3 weeks
4. After hatching tadpoles cannot swim ~5 days
5. Tadpoles require 2.5 months 18C or greater
6. Metamorphosis in late summer/fall

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

![](../img/rabo_egg_mass_gos22.jpg)

:::
:::

::: aside
*Note:* There is a great amount of plasticity depending on the region and habitat.
:::
